repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: O. Milton Gossett was an advertising executive with Compton Advertising and Saatchi & Saatchi agencies. He was also a member of the National Advertising Review Board and conducted career workshops for college students in conjunction with the American Advertising Federation. The O. Milton Gossett Papers span the years 1951-2004 and document Gossett's advertising career with the Compton Advertising (Compton) and Saatchi & Saatchi agencies, along with materials relating to the merger of Compton with Saatchi & Saatchi in 1982, including correspondence with Charles and Maurice Saatchi. The collection includes personal and professional correspondence, writings and speeches, company newsletters, and other printed materials. Also included are advertising proofs and tear sheets, television commercial scripts and storyboards, videocassettes, scrapbooks, clippings, photographs, and cutouts of company employees, as well as artifacts and memorabilia. In addition, there is information on the history of the Procter & Gamble Company and its major advertising campaigns, including a number of advertisements for Ivory Soap.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Some materials pertaining to Saatchi & Saatchi are closed until 1 January 2011.
Original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Some use copies are available in the collection.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], O. Milton Gossett Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The O. Milton Gossett Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as gifts in 2005 and 2007.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Angela McClendon, September 2006 and May 2007. Additional processing by Richard Collier, March 2008.
Encoded by Angela McClendon and Richard Collier.
Accessions 2006-0018 and 2007-0054 are described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note

eventgrp.event: Born Oscar Milton Gossett, New York, N.Y.
Degree in mechanical engineering, Stevens Institute of Technology
Vice President, Associate Creative Director, Compton Advertising
President, Member of the Board of Directors, Compton Advertising
Inducted into American Advertising Federation Hall of Fame
Received the DeWitt Carter Reddick Award

bioghist.p: Gossett was also a member of the National Advertising Review Board and conducted career workshops for college students in conjunction with the American Advertising Federation.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The O. Milton Gossett Papers span the years 1951-2004 and document Gossett's advertising career with the Compton Advertising (Compton) and Saatchi & Saatchi agencies, along with materials relating to the merger of Compton with Saatchi & Saatchi in 1982, including correspondence with Charles and Maurice Saatchi. The collection includes personal and professional correspondence, writings and speeches, company newsletters, and other printed materials. Also included are advertising proofs and tear sheets, television commercial scripts and storyboards, videocassettes, scrapbooks, clippings, photographs, and cutouts of company employees, as well as artifacts and memorabilia. In addition, there is information on the history of the Procter & Gamble Company and its major advertising campaigns, including a number of advertisements for Ivory Soap.

The collection is organized into four series: Personal Files, Administrative Files, Writings and Speeches, and Audiovisual Materials. The Personal Files Series includes personal correspondence, photographs of Gossett and his colleagues, and items relating to Gossett's international travels. Other materials document Gossett's professional life, including early resumes. Also included is a daily diary from 1960-1961. The Administrative Files Series includes corporate publications, photographs, print advertisements, television commercial scripts, storyboards, speeches, subject files, and correspondence that document Gossett's career at Compton Advertising and Saatchi & Saatchi. The Writings and Speeches Series chiefly includes speeches, written and delivered by Gossett, relating to various advertising topics. Many speeches were created as part of Gossett's American Advertising Federation workshops, and were delivered at a number of colleges and universities. Writings include magazine articles written by Gossett, as well as an introduction to an article in the Encyclopedia of Advertising and Marketing. The Audiovisual Materials Series features twenty-seven videocassettes, primarily of television commercials produced by Saatchi & Saatchi.

Large-format print materials have been removed from their original series locations and relocated to Oversize Materials. Restricted materials have also been removed from their original series locations and relocated to Restricted Materials. Relocated items have been replaced in the Detailed Description of the Collection by dummy folders enclosed in brackets.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Materials related to this collection may be found in other Hartman Center collections, including the Bates Worldwide Inc. Records and the J. Walter Thompson Company Advertising Vertical File. For materials relating to Procter & Gamble, see also the D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles Archives, the J. Walter Thompson Company Archives--Account Files Collection; Domestic Advertising Collection; and Review Board Records--and the Sheldon Sosna Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes personal correspondence, approximately 80 photographs of Gossett and his colleagues, and items relating to Gossett's international travels. Other materials document Gossett's professional life, including early resumes. Also included is a daily diary from 1960-1961. Arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: O. Milton Gossett history, 1963-1998 and undated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Compiled by Gossett, with original folder title retained; contains an award ceremony program, clipping, magazine profile, and a good letter file, with correspondence dated 1988-1998.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Includes early resumes and recommendation letter, recognition in Ad Daily, employment contracts, and business cards.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials document Gossett's advertising career at Compton Advertising and Saatchi & Saatchi. Company publications include Compton Digest, Compton People, and Saatchi & Saatchi's Perspectives, as well as a satirical newsletter about Saatchi & Saatchi entitled Eye Eye, and provide a glimpse into the corporate culture of these organizations. The series also features a set of 40 photographic cutouts of Compton employees that were used for client presentations. Although there is no contextual information regarding these figures available in this collection, there are several photographs in the Personal Files Series that feature Gossett surrounded by the figures. In addition, subject files primarily compiled by Gossett, as well as correspondence spanning from 1952-1998, provide background information on companies and colleagues. The series also includes a large body of advertising materials--print advertisements and television commercial scripts and storyboards--for clients including Black & White, Chase & Sanborn, El Producto, Kelly Tires, Knickerbocker Beer, Procter & Gamble, Socony Mobil Oil Company, and Tender Leaf Tea, among others. Ivory Soap is heavily represented through print advertisements, television commercial storyboards for the Ivory Girl campaign, as well as a New York City Department of Health campaign for AIDS awareness. Arranged alphabetically.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Restrictions on access: Some materials pertaining to Saatchi & Saatchi are restricted until 1 January 2011. These materials have been physically removed to Restricted Materials, Box 6, and replaced by dummy folders enclosed in brackets.

did.unittitle: Writings and Speeches Series, 1954-2001 and undated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes speeches, written and delivered by Gossett, relating to various advertising topics. Many speeches were created as part of Gossett's American Advertising Federation workshops, and were delivered at a number of colleges and universities. Writings include magazine articles written by Gossett, as well as an introduction to an article in the Encyclopedia of Advertising and Marketing. Preparatory materials such as notes and clippings accompany some of the items in this series. Arranged alphabetically by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Videocassettes primarily feature Saatchi & Saatchi commercials. Also included is a video recording from an event celebrating Gossett's 35th anniversary with Compton; several photographs of this event are available in the Personal Files Series.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Restrictions on access: Original videocassettes are closed to researchers. Use copies are available in the collection.
